Anyone recommend something better?

item.title: Sparky77 on "Flights to AUS"
item.dc:creator: Sparky77
item.description:
Looking at heading to Australia in July for 2 weeks, unfortunately due to work commitments got quite specific dates that I have to go on.

Has anyone got any experience on where to get the cheapest flights? Internet searches at the moment are returning flights at around the £1k mark.

item.title: billyboy on "Does 100 x 29 = 130 x 26? Anthem 29er?"
item.dc:creator: billyboy
item.description:
The answer is 2900 against 3380 according to my calculator but.......

I was looking for a trail bike full susser, and after borrowing rides of various bikes I had kinda settled on the Giant Maestro system as my preferred option. The bike I rode that hooked me was a 26er Anthem, albeit it was in a large and I need a medium. I do quite a bit of riding in the Lakes so I was looking at a Trance 26er in a medium. I sat on one in a shop and it just didn't feel right for me. I sat on an Anthem 29er and that felt right straight away, but I'm not sure it's the right bike for my intended use!!!
(The Trance 29er just seems to have the seat too far back over the stays which I know from experience will hurt my knees, and my knees have been in crisis recently so I don't want to risk it)

The question is..... will the Anthem 29er do the Walna Scar, will it do Parkamoor to Nibthwaite?

Obviously the answer is to get a demo bike and try it out, but in the meantime I'd welcome any input from folk who've ridden an Anthem 29er over Lakeland trails.

item.title: ChrisE on "Tell me about USB charging cameras"
item.dc:creator: ChrisE
item.description:
I want to get a new camera, one that charges the battery through a USB cable (rather than a dedicated take the battery out type charger). I'm struggling to find a list of what cameras do that and even when looking on the manufacturers websites they offer conflicting infomation.

anyone have any clues or advice?

I need;
USB charging
lightweight
auto
about 14MP
compact

for multi-day, even multi-week rides

ta

C

item.title: lemonysam on "Newcastle commuter types"
item.dc:creator: lemonysam
item.description:
Ok, so I seem to have got a great new job (hooray!) in the city my girlfriend and I want to settle in/near. We're planning on living out Wylam way and I'd like to commute by bike to the town centre (station end of Westgate Rd).

First up, obviously the paths along the river are great for a sunday pootle but I've not really used them for getting to and from the city. Do they choke up at rush hour and are they usable most of the year? Would they be road bike friendly or is this a great excuse for a CXer?

Secondly, I'm not sure that the place I'm working at has bike storage, what are bike parking options in town like? If theft/damage a major issue? Can you use the station platform racks without buying a ticket?

Cheers,
Sam

item.title: mikeyay on "Wtd: Complete hydraulic Brake set up"
item.dc:creator: mikeyay
item.description:
Wanted complete hydraulic brake set up, ideally iso caliper mounts front and rear and 180 / 160mm discs. Email in profile.
Cheers. Mick

item.title: pbooker1995 on "Orange Alpine 160 Split! XTR Mech, Brakes, X Fusion, Fox, Thomson, Giant Dropper"
item.dc:creator: pbooker1995
item.description:
Splitting my Alpine as its just too much bike for me.

Collection only on the frame.

1. 2012 Orange Alpine 160 Frame- Striker Orange team colour. (Very bright). Is in good condition, few stone chips, and slight cable rub but running well. Included is a Fox RP23 Boost Valve rear shock and Hope tapered Headset. £900

2. X Fusion Vengeance Air HLR. Top of the range. High and low speed compression. 20mm axle with a T40 drifted in as the 5mm bolt had rounded. Cable rub on the crown and lowers. A couple of very slight marks to stanchions, but doesn't affect it. Steerer about 190mm. Working great. £300

3. XTR Trail Brakes. M988 levers on M985 Calipers. Calipers are spotless. Levers have slight marking on clamp from putting bike upside down. Working great. £220

4. XTR Clutch rear mech. Working great. Few marks but pretty much straight. £80

5. Raceface Evolve Cranks. Great condition. Few little marks. 34t e 13 ring included. £70

6. Fox Float RLC FIT 140's in White. have come back from mojo today after a service. New decals, oil, low friction seals etc. Slight cable rub, but hardly noticable. 15mm axle. Steerer around 180mm. Stanchions are mint. £375.

7. Thomson X4 Elite Stem. Good condition. OS Bars. 50/60mm long. 1 1/8 steerer. £40

8. Giant Contact Dropper post. 30.9mm with 100mm drop. Great working order. £100

Open to offers and pics are available. Email in profile.

item.title: Sand Crab on "Storing Bikes"
item.dc:creator: Sand Crab
item.description:
Hi,

The Queen is sending me on an all-expenses paid 6 month trip to somewhere non bike friendly ("what tyres for land mines?" thread to follow) so they will be stuck in the garage. So, do I need to do anything to them before I go?

I've heard of storing them upside down, draining the brakes, letting air out of shocks etc so any advice great fully received.

Ta

Chris

item.title: Scapegoat on "WTD XT 770 crank"
item.dc:creator: Scapegoat
item.description: Testing the water, I'm after an XT crankset in nice nick. With or without rings, but it needs granny tabs as I want to make it 2x. I'd like it to be heel rub free, not too bothered about the odd rock strike. What's out there? Email wholestonedaveATaolDOTcom

item.title: tymbian on "One for the literati."
item.dc:creator: tymbian
item.description:
Is there a word that descrpibes the use of say word A to describe word B but word A has the opposite meaning...I'll explain..

Doctor asks.." how are you finding your new diet "?

Teenage patient.." it's phat "

Or

Waiter to teen " how's your food? "

Teen " Sick " ( means awesome )

I thought of these two today whilst preparing tea. I'm sure there must be others but can't think of any, and these two are modern variants that would of only come about the last few years.

item.title: dogbert on "Weight Watchers.......anyone tried it?"
item.dc:creator: dogbert
item.description:
Chubbiness is my enemy

So today on that there Groupon, there is an offer for Online Weight Watchers, 3 months, 18 quid. Just wondering if anyone had tried it with any success?

I know, go out on bike, eat less and all that, but I'm one of those people that needs a regiment to stick to

item.title: daftvader on "She said yes!"
item.dc:creator: daftvader
item.description:
evening...

mrs vader has said that after my wrist op and recovery i will be allowed to buy a new bike so long as I(not we)have the money for it.
looking at several bikes atm....

lapierre x flow
scott spark
cannondale rz120 (if i can find one)
camber
sc superlight

i have tested the rz120, will be getting a test of the rest as soon as i have the ok to ride by the doctors

so STW..... opinions, suggestions and alternatives please

cheers

item.title: SimonC on "SIDs with a 220mm steerer"
item.dc:creator: SimonC
item.description: A long shot, but does anyone have a pair of SIDs with a 220mm steerer going spare? Ideally I'm looking to pay under £200 and have them in a colour that's not white, but beggars can't be choosers. Other 100mm lightweight XC forks also considered.
